result.execSummary:
The defendant Fue Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or a combination of both.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work or treatment- I&S for rules violations

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:48 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF59, 14CF576 & 14CF793**
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in person with Attorney John Bliss. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.
State moves to: 14CF59- DRI Ct.2- Possess Drug Paraphernalia, 14CF576- DRI Ct.2- Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, DRI Ct.3- Bail Jumping (Felony), DRI Ct.4- Possess Drug Paraphernalia, 14CF793- DRI Ct.1- Bail Jumping (Felony) 
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 14CF59- Ct.1- Possession of Methamphetamine>>GUILTY
           14CF576- Ct.1- Possession w/Intent- Amphetamine (PTAC)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF59- Ct.1- 6 months MCJ with huber for work or treatment- to begin within 55 days, CC & DNA surcharge. 14CF576- Ct.1- SWH 6 years probation. CONDITIONS: Any assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, 6 months MCJ with huber for work or treatment- imposed and stayed for rules violations, AODA and any follow-up, GFE to obtain and maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both, maintain absolute sobriety, CC & DNA surcharge. Credit for time served for 14CF59 to be determined and submitted to the COC office. 
Adj: 11:03 a.m.

Surety T.V.

Plea/sentencing hearing on February 20, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Case called: 9:29am. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Lance Leonhard. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Jack Bliss.  Waiver of Prelim. filed.  Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived. Plea: NOT GUILTY. Bond:  Continued. DATES: PTC 7/31/14 @ 4pm. CC: BR 2. Adj: 9:31am.
Pre-trial conference on July 31, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

No contact with co-defendant(s):  X.V.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 1 business day - Day Report Program.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of controlled substance unless as prescribed to defendant and then only as written.
